alert.note: Alert for Carson; Gray (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 6:25PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong group of thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Carson and southwestern Gray Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 624 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong group of thunderstorms 7 miles northwest of Lake Mcclellan, or 18 miles south of Pampa, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Groom and Lake Mcclellan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
